commit_message:
set default LIBVIRT_CPU_MODEL based on ARCH

This change mainntains the current default for x86_64
updates LIBVIRT_CPU_MODEL to max on aarch64 and
qemu64 for lack of a better default on anything else.

To ensure correct defaults, fallback to qemu is moved to
stackrc and aarch64 host are only set to host-passthrough
if kvm is available.

Change-Id: Ie3175069db75c4b3a7a3cfd9df136017c22618df
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/devstack refs/changes/32/828632/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Check for kvm (hardware based virtualization). If unable to initialize # kvm, we drop back to the slower emulation mode (qemu). Note: many systems # come with hardware virtualization disabled in BIOS. if [[ "$LIBVIRT_TYPE" == "kvm" ]]; then sudo modprobe kvm || true if [ ! -e /dev/kvm ]; then echo "WARNING: Switching to QEMU" LIBVIRT_TYPE=qemu if which selinuxenabled >/dev/null 2>&1 && selinuxenabled; then # https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=753589 sudo setsebool virt_use_execmem on fi fi fi if is_arch "aarch64" && [ ${LIBVIRT_TYPE} == "kvm" ]; then LIBVIRT_CPU_MODE=${LIBVIRT_CPU_MODE:-"host-passthrough"} else LIBVIRT_CPU_MODE=${LIBVIRT_CPU_MODE:-custom} fi if [[ -z ${LIBVIRT_CPU_MODEL} && ${LIBVIRT_CPU_MODE} == "custom" ]]; then if [ is_arch "x86" || is_arch "x86_64) ]; then LIBVIRT_CPU_MODEL=Nehalem elif [ is_arch "aarch64" ]; then LIBVIRT_CPU_MODEL=max else LIBVIRT_CPU_MODEL=qemu64 fi fi

commit_message:
Use master upper-constraints when install_temepst's creating venv

Below patch has changed the configure_tempest() to use
master branch's upper-constraints to avoid conflict in requirement
- https://review.openstack.org/#/c/473525/

install_tempest() still use the branch based upper_contraint. Which
has no issue as the same venv will be build/install with master's
upper_constraint in configure_tempest() method.

We can use master's upper_constraint in install_tempest() also
so that from starting of venv creation we use master constraint
and avoid duplicate uninstall/install the dependency.

Change-Id: I5e7b58eb0c07c509e340afbfcd2b402c651c3731
Related-bug: #1706009
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/devstack refs/changes/37/639637/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # The requirements might be on a different branch, while tempest needs master requirements. (cd $REQUIREMENTS_DIR && git show master:upper-constraints.txt) > u-c-m.txt $TEMPEST_DIR/.tox/tempest/bin/pip install -c u-c-m.txt -r requirements.txt # The requirements might be on a different branch, while tempest & tempest plugins needs master requirements. (cd $REQUIREMENTS_DIR && git show master:upper-constraints.txt) > u-c-m.txt tox -evenv-tempest -- pip install -c u-c-m.txt $TEMPEST_PLUGINS

commit_message:
Re-apply "Fix rdo-release install"

The fix in Change-Id Icb07dcb4c9a3950a3c31a3a8dcb8d0b4c713fdb1 was
reverted in Change-Id If7ddbd6655086657db03074a27a2d47053fd88e0. In
doing so, deployments from stable branches reverted to install master
RDO repositories.

Change-Id: I8c0c0e34c3d5fdc72d4d8fa23c670314b3ac20ae
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/devstack refs/changes/84/776084/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: if [[ "$TARGET_BRANCH" == "master" ]]; then local deps="$(get_extra_file https://trunk.rdoproject.org/centos8/delorean-deps.repo)" sudo cp $deps /etc/yum.repos.d/ else # Get latest rdo-release-$rdo_release RPM package version local rdo_release=$(echo $TARGET_BRANCH | sed "s|stable/||g") yum_install https://rdoproject.org/repos/openstack-$rdo_release/rdo-release-$rdo_release.rpm fi
deleted_lines: # NOTE(ianw) 2020-04-30 : when we have future branches, we # probably want to install the relevant branch RDO release as # well. But for now it's all master. local deps="$(get_extra_file https://trunk.rdoproject.org/centos8/delorean-deps.repo)" sudo cp $deps /etc/yum.repos.d/

commit_message:
Install master delorean-deps

Package rdo-release.rpm is intended to configure CloudSIG repositories,
and those are only for released versions. It defaults to the latest
released OpenStack series. As so, required greatest and latest
dependencies in master OpenStack may not be met. For CentOS-based master
devstack deployments the latest and greatest dependency packages need to
be available, and that is provided by master delorean-deps [1].

[1] https://dlrn.readthedocs.io/en/latest/repositories.html#dlrn-repository-delorean-deps

Change-Id: Id9f96f6dd55e964c32a7da8633c5acea2e1133b8

commit_message:
Added Zuul job devstack-reboot-tempest

This job will reboot the host before running Tempest,
which will catch issues with e.g. ephemeral loop devices.

Change-Id: I3b4c226409c92854b486261deaece7f94566e108

commit_message:
Add control plane testing during update.

We use a light shell daemon to start "workload_launch.sh sanityfast"
in a loop.

The daemon, collect the log of each individual run in a "ccp-<PID>"
directory and the result in check-control-plane-<PID>.log.  The pid
can be found in check-control-plane.pid.

In tripleo-upgrade we add the usual check integration at the relevant
part of the update. The new boolean option
"--update-controlplane-check" is added to the infrared interface.

By default this test is not activated. control_plane_check variable
control that behavior outside of infrared.

Change-Id: Ieff860667cf67a1c1f67221b05575e952a0636fa

commit_message:
Fix floating ip selection

The floating ip selection didn't count with possibility of
stopped workloads on the environment. We now list running hosts
and join them against available virtual ips.

Co-authored-by: Daniel Bengtsson <dbengt@redhat.com>
Change-Id: I7d46100eccf43159f47e620d14fae3b66701a4d9
(cherry picked from commit cd5a4287461b91d57b7058ad63928436b0f1efcb)

commit_message:
Use SDK instead of neutronclient

The python-neutronclient has been deprecated for the CLI since Ocata and
the python bindings "neutronclient" has been deprecated for removal as
of the 2023.1 (Antelope) release[1] in favor of using openstacksdk.
This patch migrates Designate from using the neutronclient to using the
openstacksdk for communicating with neutron.

[1] https://docs.openstack.org/releasenotes/python-neutronclient/2023.1.html

Co-Authored-By: Michael Johnson <johnsomor@gmail.com>
Change-Id: I0198f38afe3d5c32ea06d9e674ab0ff849f360e6
Related-Bug: #1999774
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/designate refs/changes/91/874991/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: import openstackdef get_client(context, endpoint, region): 'auth_url': CONF['network_api:neutron'].auth_url, 'region_name': region, # TODO(lajoskatona): Add this to network_api cfg section 'project_domain_name': 'default', params['auth_type'] = 'token' params['project_name'] = CONF['network_api:neutron'].admin_tenant_name return openstack.connect(**params) client = get_client(context, endpoint=endpoint, region=region) try: fips = client.network.ips(project_id=project_id) for fip in fips: except openstack.exceptions.HttpException as http_ex: 'due to a %(cause)s error', {'region': region, 'endpoint': endpoint, 'cause': http_ex.message}
deleted_lines: from neutronclient.common import exceptions as neutron_exceptions from neutronclient.v2_0 import client as clientv20def get_client(context, endpoint): return clientv20.Client(**params) client = get_client(context, endpoint=endpoint) try: fips = client.list_floatingips(project_id=project_id) for fip in fips['floatingips']: except neutron_exceptions.Unauthorized: 'due to an Unauthorized error', {'region': region, 'endpoint': endpoint}

subject: Pin openvswitch package on RHEL to 2.17
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2023-03-31 12:32:45.000000000', 'files': ['vars/redhat-9.yml'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible-openstack_hosts/commit/80b9efcd423f72a6c16d1d2295fc14a3b8d89325', 'message': "Pin openvswitch package on RHEL to 2.17

OVS 3.1 was released by CentOS NFV SIG which is built against newer
rdma-core libraries leading to uninstallable openvswitch3.1 on
Rocky Linux due to missing libmlx5.so.1(MLX5_1.24).

While CentOS doesn't need this specific rollback, it will be easier to
fix gates this way.

commit_message:
Pin openvswitch package on RHEL to 2.17

OVS 3.1 was released by CentOS NFV SIG which is built against newer
rdma-core libraries leading to uninstallable openvswitch3.1 on
Rocky Linux due to missing libmlx5.so.1(MLX5_1.24).

While CentOS doesn't need this specific rollback, it will be easier to
fix gates this way.

Closes-Bug: #2013189
Change-Id: I388c115d368c0c0638d1dd4f9f11f4448a13a6b1
(cherry picked from commit 181036c13bd2e9b09dabba6faea827c99a8adf6c)

commit_message:
Add virtualization (virt) repo to StarlingX

This new repository will be the new place to store code related to
StarlingX virtualization packages and tools.
It will be the result of splitting the virt directory from
starlingx/integ in order to separate the virtualization stack from it.

Signed-off-by: Thales Elero Cervi <thaleselero.cervi@windriver.com>
Change-Id: I3195abfc9ef5b156b5a8591b1d6b595c76081658

commit_message:
Allow extend_volume for local devices

The local connector is a simple wrapper around an existing device.
Since the device was already set up by some external process, we
can assume that there is also a way to allow extending the volume.

In the extend_volume method, we just return the size of the device, in
the expectation that it was already resized by some external process.

Change-Id: I7d66e9d0b697cd71a72baef5c267c36da78a857e

commit_message:
Expose executor_thread_pool_size

This option has been supported by puppet-oslo but has not been
configurable.

Conflicts:
	manifests/init.pp

(yoga to xena)

commit_message:
Remove job waiter thread for zookeeper

A thread is created for waiting jobs when using the Redis backend,
there's no need for calling it when using Zookeeper and it may have
called a function (extend_expiry) that is specific to the Redis
jobboard.

Story 2010680
Task 47764

Change-Id: I514d6182637c9e4465c2e707449c9bdc61cdf5d2
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/octavia refs/changes/60/879160/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: --- fixes: - | Fixed a potential issue with the Zookeeper Jobboard backend, the Octavia controller may have called a taskflow function specific to the Redis backend. This function is now called only when using Redis.

commit_message:
Fix pristine status

Only check configured devices instead of all system devices and don't check already processed devices when computing pristine status

Closes-Bug: #1988088
Change-Id: Ia6bf7a5b7abddb72c3ec61fd9e02daf42e94c2da
func-test-pr: https://github.com/openstack-charmers/zaza-openstack-tests/pull/1032
(cherry picked from commit 22dfd2cc8f9f9a1bc14bfcb827fad47a9c97ac17)

added_lines: # Check unmounted disks that should be configured but don't check # journals or already processed devices config_devices = (set(get_devices()) & set(ceph.unmounted_disks())) osd_journals = set(get_journal_devices()) touched_devices = set(kv().get('osd-devices', [])) for dev in config_devices - osd_journals - touched_devices:
deleted_lines: osd_journals = get_journal_devices() for dev in list(set(ceph.unmounted_disks()) - set(osd_journals)):

commit_message:
db: Remove session kwargs from share APIs

This one is huge because the various queries are really tightly knitted.
The changes are pretty much all identical, however.

Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <stephenfin@redhat.com>
Change-Id: I26cf45882edbfce38487d8648d4d77d120f379c9

commit_message:
db: Remove session kwargs from export location metadata APIs

Turns out none of these APIs are used elsewhere in the codebase so
there's no need for them to be public.

Change-Id: I7a3f0d3bc33809a22e28e07155706dad148e8569
Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <stephenfin@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Fix floating ip selection

The floating ip selection didn't count with possibility of
stopped workloads on the environment. We now list running hosts
and join them against available virtual ips.

Co-authored-by: Lukas Bezdicka <social@v3.sk>
Change-Id: I8df76b707abf2e6030bb01eb29bcb31b13b8fbb2

commit_message:
Rework zuul config

Current zuul.yaml file is simply way to big to be able to navigate in it
easily. We are going to add some more acceptance jobs which bring quite
big secrets and this will make it even less maintainable.

Split .zuul.yaml into few zuul.d/* entries using Zuul capability to have
few "project" entries and get them merged.

Change-Id: I9c6a85d4d6f1cdfcb5a339bca4293d54d5cf8746

commit_message:
Blueprint for separated haproxy service config

Change-Id: I26febd71333bf2d98e214da19a733bf0964fe865
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible-specs refs/changes/87/871187/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: Separated Haproxy Service Config ################################# :date: 2023-01-19 22:00 :tags: separated haproxy service config, internal tls Currently all haproxy services are configured during exection of haproxy_server role. It may cause issues with variables scope and may complately break a service until service role is executed. These issues may be avoided if the current behavior will be changed and haproxy services will be configured separately at the beginning of each service playbook. Problem description =================== Preconfiguring all haproxy services may lead to some issues. There are 2 examples: 1. Variables scope Currently service definitions for haproxy roles stored in inventory/group_vars/haproxy.yml contain variables like `neutron_plugin_type`. It makes a problem because this is neutron's variable. If someone wants to change its default value, they will probably set an override in neutron group variables. It's problematic because haproxy is not in neutron group, so all neutron's group variables won't have an effect for haproxy role. In order to make haproxy respect this change, variable needs to be defined for all hosts so both haproxy and neutron will have an access to it. Additionally, we are currently working on encrypting traffic between haproxy and service backends. Proposed PoC [1] does the same thing as described above. It makes use of `glance_backend_https` variable belonging to glance role. 2. Strong dependency between haproxy role and service roles Some changes in haproxy service need immediate reaction from service role. For example: user enables TLS for communication between haproxy and glance backends. In order to do that, haproxy role needs to be executed. It will configure glance service to communicate with its backends over TLS, but at this point backends are not ready to handle TLS connections. In order to fix it, glance role needs to be executed, but it takes time and increases downtime. Removing dependencies like this between roles would make configuration process more reliable. Please note that downtime will still occur. It will start after haproxy service config and finish after first backend host will be configured. In order to provide zero-downtime transition to TLS, further work related to "internal TLS" project is required. Proposed change =============== Add an extra step at the beginning of each service role to configure haproxy service(s) for it. In this case haproxy services will be configured separately, so nova playbook will configure nova haproxy services, glance playbook will configure its own haproxy services etc. Haproxy playbook will be only responsible for configuring services not related to any role(letsencrypt, ceph-rgw, custom user-defined services etc.) Alternatives ------------ No alternatives. Playbook/Role impact -------------------- Each playbook will contain an extra step responsible for configuring haproxy service role(s) for it. Upgrade impact -------------- Some variables may become depracated or their behavior may change. Security impact --------------- No impact. Performance impact ------------------ No impact. End user impact --------------- No impact. Deployer impact --------------- From now on, haproxy services will be configured separately when running service playbooks(like os-nova-install.yml) Developer impact ---------------- No impact. Dependencies ------------ No dependencies. Implementation ============== Assignee(s) ----------- Primary assignee: Damian Dabrowski <damian@dabrowski.cloud> Work items ---------- - configure haproxy_server role to support separated service config - configure service playbooks to include an extra step to configure haproxy service - solve all corner cases(like dependency between letsencrypt and horizon) Testing ======= Special attention is required for gating. Merging this change for all roles may be complicated. Documentation impact ==================== Documentation needs to be double checked. For sure we will need to update it in few places. References ========== [1] https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/openstack-ansible/+/821090

commit_message:
Support ISCDHCPDriver for Standalone Deployment

Ironic currently supports several dhcp provider:neutron,none.
We have only one option for deploying ironic node with standalone.
We need to configure dhcp manually in this case.
New DHCP Provider will be added for standalone deployment.
ISCDHCPDriver configures isc-dhcp-server which is
default dhcp server automatically
therefore we does not have to handle manually.

Change-Id: I6b548c913bb1502ca83fe73a343a4f2dd33f628a
Related-Bug: #1741377

commit_message:
Add neutron-ironic port mapping function

Related-Bug: #1552364
Co-Authored-By: Sivaramakrishna Garimella (sivaramakrishna.garimella@hp.com)
Change-Id: I633ff272f1e5438f2d58464d4af5e00ef04ce5b7
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/ironic-specs refs/changes/48/279148/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: .. This work is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution 3.0 Unported License. http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/3.0/legalcode ================= Port mapping between Neutron and Ironic ================= please advise if [1]_ should be used as the RFE bug or a new one created. https://bugs.launchpad.net/ironic/+bug/XXXXXX Ironic ports and portgroups correspond to the physical NICs that are availabe on baremetal nodes. Neutron ports are logical ports that are created on tenant networks. When booting a baremetal node that are attached to multiple tenant networks, these two types of objects need to be properly mapped to each other so that the ironic ports or portgroups are used for the intended tenant networks. Problem description =================== As it stands right now, mapping from neutron ports to ironic ports are not done in a predeterministic manner (Refer to [1]_). Given that a neutron port is associated with a physical network, the proposed patch [2]_ tries to fix the problem by tagging the corresponding ironic port with the same physical network. In this spec, we'll try to go further so that multiple neutron ports on different tenant networks can be mapped to the same ironic port. The ironic neutron ml2 integration blueprint (Refer to [3]_) differentiates between a provisioning network and tenant networks, and supports network flip logic so that ironic ports can transition from being attached to a provisioning network to being attached to tenant networks. However, it doesn't provide a mechanism on mapping tenant networks to ironic ports. Another problem is associated with the method macs_for_instance() in the virt driver. The method is designed to return a list of mac addresses based on the existing ironic ports on a node, which are then assgined to neutron ports. This is undesirable. Not only is it not deterministic, it also makes the logic in the networking driver cumbersome and hard to understand. Proposed change =============== We propose the use of mapping functions to map neutron ports to ironic ports and/or portgroups. With neutron provider net, a neutron tenant network is associated with a provider net with the following properties: * network_type: vlan, vxlan or gre * physical_network: the name of the physical network attached * segmentation_id: vlan id in the case of vlan. This spec only specifies a mapping function for the vlan network type. Mapping functions can be provided for other network types, but they are out of scope. For the vlan network type, we propose a mapping function that operates with two properties: * physical network: the name of the physical network * vlan operation mode: trunk or access The properties are tagged onto an ironic port or portgroup. A neutron port is mapped to an ironic port or portgroup when they are attached to the same physical network. If an ironic port or portgroup is operating with trunk mode, then multiple neutron ports on the same physical network can be mapped to it. Tagging of ironic ports or portgroups can be done either manually or through other means (e.g. ironic inspection that supports LLDP port description). The properties are added into the ironic port's local_link_connection. We also propose that macs_for_instance() should be deprecated. Instead, mac addresses should be directly assigned to the requested networks (the NICs in terms of nova boot) by calling a method in the virt driver with the requested networks as input. With the help of the mapping function, the mac address for a requested network can be determined from the matching ironic port or portgroup. If the requested network comes in the form of a neutron port, then the neutron port's mac address should be updated. If it comes in the form of neutron tenant network, then a neutorn port is created with the assigned mac address. Note that nova supports multiple NICs that are attached to the same tenant network. The proposed mapping function doens't support this, but maybe enhanced to support it in the future when its use cases arise. With the help of the mapping function, an ironic neutron plugin may operate as in below: * The provisioning network will be placed on an ironic port (note not portgroup in this case) on the same physical network that has pxeboot enabled. A neutorn port on the provisioning network is created with the ironic port's local_link_connection. * Once deploy is completed, the provisioning network is removed from the ironic port. For each neutron port, an ironic port (or portgroup) is found based on the mapping function, and the neutron port is updated with the ironic port's local_link_connection. With tagging, a portgroup can only be formed with memeber ports on the same physical network. Alternatives ------------ TBD Data model impact ----------------- None State Machine Impact -------------------- None REST API impact --------------- New fields are added into local_link_connection. The property physical_network is required. The property vlan_mode is optional and is defaulted to trunk (or access?) Client (CLI) impact ------------------- None "ironic" CLI ~~~~~~~~~~~~ Add support to the new fields in the local_link_connection "openstack baremetal" CLI ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~ None RPC API impact -------------- None Driver API impact ----------------- ironic neutron plugin enhanced to work with the mapping function Nova driver impact ------------------ macs_for_instance() is deprecated, and a new API to assign MACs directly to the requested networks (nova NICs, and thus neutron ports) Security impact --------------- None Other end user impact --------------------- None Scalability impact ------------------ None Performance Impact ------------------ None Other deployer impact --------------------- TBD Developer impact ---------------- TBD Implementation ============== Assignee(s) ----------- TBD Work Items ---------- . ironic CLI . Nova . ironic virt driver . ironic neutron plugin Dependencies ============ TBD Testing ======= TBD Upgrades and Backwards Compatibility ==================================== TBD Documentation Impact ==================== TBD References ========== .. [1] `ports cannot be mapped to networks <https://bugs.launchpad.net/ironic/+bug/1405131>` .. [2] `Map physical ports to networks <https://review.openstack.org/#/c/153230>` .. [3] `[RFE] Ironic Neutron ML2 Integration <https://bugs.launchpad.net/ironic/+bug/1526403>`

commit_message:
Limit usage of old OVS to Rocky only

As we've landed fix for CentOS to work properly with new OVS and
workarounded bug, we can now start using new OVS version for stream.

Exclude can be removed once issue will be sorted out for Rocky as well.

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/openstack-ansible-os_neutron/+/878911
Change-Id: I864cb07231ebf5c820c2ce3721323bebdc337e13

subject: Disable CentOS LXC jobs due to the bug in systemd packaging
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2023-03-31 14:37:20.000000000', 'files': ['zuul.d/project.yaml'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible-os_neutron/commit/4591ec5caa751f5827ee8d9710d7025f709b8897', 'message': "Disable CentOS LXC jobs due to the bug in systemd packaging

At the moment systemd-udev package is being resolved to
systemd-boot-unsigned due to CentOS packaging issue. Resolution to this
issue would be providing a full path to any of file that is not provided
but systemd-boot-unsigned but provided by systemd-udev
which does not have a really clean and good workaround.

So we're disabling CentOS LXC jobs for now and waiting for CentOS
waiting to fix this. There're bunch of bug reports and all systemd there
in quite a messy state overall.

Change-Id: I6e744d1e708df11204b3436c53ea6ed723683b18
(cherry picked from commit dffcff7c94804433f8fbbe4b326f7f39d11fe0b7)
"}]
commit_message:
Disable CentOS LXC jobs due to the bug in systemd packaging

At the moment systemd-udev package is being resolved to
systemd-boot-unsigned due to CentOS packaging issue. Resolution to this
issue would be providing a full path to any of file that is not provided
but systemd-boot-unsigned but provided by systemd-udev
which does not have a really clean and good workaround.

So we're disabling CentOS LXC jobs for now and waiting for CentOS
waiting to fix this. There're bunch of bug reports and all systemd there
in quite a messy state overall.

Change-Id: I6e744d1e708df11204b3436c53ea6ed723683b18
(cherry picked from commit dffcff7c94804433f8fbbe4b326f7f39d11fe0b7)

commit_message:
Update TOX_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/2023.1

Update the URL to the upper-constraints file to point to the redirect
rule on releases.openstack.org so that anyone working on this branch
will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when
the requirements repository branches.

Until the requirements repository has as stable/2023.1 branch, tests will
continue to use the upper-constraints list on master.

commit_message:
Update TOX_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/2023.1

Update the URL to the upper-constraints file to point to the redirect
rule on releases.openstack.org so that anyone working on this branch
will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when
the requirements repository branches.

Until the requirements repository has as stable/2023.1 branch, tests will
continue to use the upper-constraints list on master.

Change-Id: Ibdef4c93fe5fcab930d8b5e15ece8664a1169895

subject: Pin tox to < 4.0.0
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2023-01-13 20:08:36.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/charm-nova-cloud-controller/commit/0ecd15dec058d7a024f57b073ae5d7216a71d2d3', 'message': "Pin tox to < 4.0.0

Tox 4.0.0 was recently released and it has several breaking changes.
We pin to < 4.0.0 here. We are planning to move forward only on the
master charm branches.

Tox is also pinned to < 4.0.0 for stable branches in upstream
openstack-zuul-jobs as well as in zosci-config. However, the
requires= section in the charm's tox.ini file ends up installing
tox>4, wiping out the zuul-pinned tox<4 that was already installed
installed. This patch fixes that.

commit_message:
Pin tox to < 4.0.0

Tox 4.0.0 was recently released and it has several breaking changes.
We pin to < 4.0.0 here. We are planning to move forward only on the
master charm branches.

Tox is also pinned to < 4.0.0 for stable branches in upstream
openstack-zuul-jobs as well as in zosci-config. However, the
requires= section in the charm's tox.ini file ends up installing
tox>4, wiping out the zuul-pinned tox<4 that was already installed
installed. This patch fixes that.

Related-Bug: #2002788
Change-Id: I4609031f6980cf5bda9ceaca2ec200b0187f181c

commit_message:
Prepare acceptance tests for real clouds

- reworked job not to use custom modules, but rather send direct API
  requests (due to mess with ensuring openstacksdk availability for
  Ansible).
- add exclude for pre-commit-config to stop it from complaining on
  zuul.yaml
- removed too verbose logging from functests with list of images and
  flavors (on real clouds this is simply too much).

Change-Id: I555127f410b696e1584dc07cafac25597ab1abeb

commit_message:
Update TOX_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/2023.1

Update the URL to the upper-constraints file to point to the redirect
rule on releases.openstack.org so that anyone working on this branch
will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when
the requirements repository branches.

Until the requirements repository has as stable/2023.1 branch, tests will
continue to use the upper-constraints list on master.

Change-Id: Ie2700c926469e5a2fd73d067a6f3b136ce169700

commit_message:
Replace old Antelope cycle key with 2023.2/Bobcat

This is a zuul-encrypted export of the signing subkey for the
OpenStack 2023.2/Bobcat release cycle:
0x815AFEC729392386480E076DCC0DFE2D21C023C9

This was created using the instructions from our documentation:
https://docs.opendev.org/opendev/system-config/latest/signing.html

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/878143

Change-Id: Ie19c164d3aa0711420f5deb90237f0268c174942

commit_message:
Publish the 2023.2/Bobcat key for future use

This adds a listing for the 2023.2/Bobcat Cycle key fingerprint with
Friday 2023-03-31 (the week after the 2023.1/Antelope release) as
its start date, and links to an export of the corresponding public
key with initial attestation signature from the 2023.1/Antelope
Cycle key as well as the change author.

Change-Id: I9aaf9b7d513f6b2845a518c84ea2c381ff297220

commit_message:
Add cross-nova-pep8 job

Both cinder and nova CI got broken by a recent mypy bump [0],[1].
We can try to catch these issues before the requirements update gets
merged. See also [2] for the corresponding cinder test job.

[0] https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/cinder/+/875534
[1] https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/nova/+/878693
[2] https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/requirements/+/878690

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/nova/+/878693
Change-Id: I737a50e7efa2c67987f08aebc3ec0b0448ad73e5
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/requirements refs/changes/48/878748/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
